1.18.18  3:28 pm   Hey Bill, you have said that you recommend starting new things with small projects. I've started making digital music, so in that case should I start by making short songs?

      Or like using only a few tracks and instruments?

      I have trouble finishing songs, but if they're too short it will feel as if they haven't even started.
1.18.18  3:19 pm   What was your inspiration to write "I'm crazy (it's raining)?"

1.18.18  3:15 pm   bill at around 11 seconds into the new video after the line "or to be like you" you do a little drum fill with your mouth half open and looking sort of suprised. im wondering was this influenced by other drummers because they sort of do the same thing.

      for example in the hello goodbye music video at 1.16 https://youtu.be/rblYSKz_VnI?t=1m16s  ringo starr does the same thing, suprised with a slightly opened mouth while doing a drum fill. were you inspired, or was this coincidental?

1.18.18  11:44 am   Instrumentation seems very easy for you, but in many songs I find it hard to make multiple parts while still keeping the melody intact. How did you find a way to use multiple instruments playing different parts, while still keeping the melody intact?
1.18.18  11:28 am   How the hell do you maintain the level of your presence on the internet?

1.18.18  11:17 am   You usually answer a lot of questions right after you post a project. It because you want to see the feedback or you just feel that you can't work in anything else for a moment.

      After I spent so much time and energy to finish something I feel like a void, I just don't know what to do next, so I need to do a break
